snippet: HealthBridge Management has been ordered to bring back nearly 600 employees in Connecticut who went on strike in July and to rescind the pension and health care cuts it had imposed.
abstract: Federal Judge Robert N Chatigny orders HealthBridge Management nursing home chain to reinstate nearly 600 workers in Connecticut who went on strike in July, and to rescind the pension and health care cuts that had been imposed on workers; rules that HealthBridge had broken the law by refusing to bargain in good faith and imposing cuts before a true negotiating impasse had been reached.
lead_paragraph: HealthBridge Management has been ordered to bring back nearly 600 employees in Connecticut who went on strike in July and to rescind the pension and health care cuts it had imposed.

headline.seo: HealthBridge Managemant Ordered to Reinstate Striking Workers
headline.main: Nursing Homes Told to Reinstate Workers
headline.print_headline: Nursing Homes Told to Reinstate Workers
